attributes.action: lend the support of the UK Government to bring about change in Sudan through supporting the Darfur Peace Process; join in efforts to ensure that the 2010 Sudanese National Elections are peaceful and meaningful; re-focusing international attention on the urgent humanitarian need.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
As UK voters we would like the UK Government do the following:

[Peace Process]
-Support participants in the build-up to the Doha Peace talks to help build coherent, consensual political positions
-Facilitate and encourage constructive engagement by all parties for the full duration required to achieve a meaningful outcome
-Support efforts to emphasise and facilitate positive participation by Darfurian Civil Society

[Elections]
-Encourage political groups to commit to peace before, during and after the elections
-Offer the UK’s technical expertise and monitoring
-Support the African Union in its work to nurture a genuine Sudanese political process
-Work with the UN to speed up the deployment of UNAMID, so that it is fully staffed and functional

[Humanitarian need]
-Use the UK’s comparative advantages in media, and its platform in the UN to highlight the continued needs of those affected by ongoing insecurity
-Encourage all parties to facilitate unrestricted humanitarian access to those in need
